values.coastal_flooding_oem: Current and modeled potential water surface.
values.default: Future planning horizons representing the impact of climate change.

values.coastal_flooding_oem:
Modeled storm surge from North Carolina Sea Level Rise Impact Study.
Mean High High Water (MHHW): The average of all the high water heights observed over a period of several years.
10-yr event: A coastal flood event with a 10% chance of occurring annually. Has a 96% chance of occurring over a 30-yr mortgage.
100-year event: A coastal flood event with a 1% chance of occurring annually. Has a 26% chance of occurring over a 30-yr mortgage.
Hurricane Fran: Modeled storm surge using conditions from this 1996 event.
values.default: Sea level rise scenarios (low, medium, and high) based on regional sea level rise amounts.

coastal_flooding_oem.url: Data was acquired from NC Emergency Management through a public records request. For data or information on this project contact NC Emergency Management.
